I have played this game several times and found new things in every playthrough. It is a great game tying in the story from the other two games perfectly. The gameplay is similiar to the first two with some different asthetics to everything. It can be challenging in a good way unless you play 1999 mode which is brutal. The DLC explains alot in the story that left questions not just in this game but from the first one as well. The plot is well designed and keeps you on your toes. 5/5 would play again.
This game and this franchise remains one of my all time favorite video games/franchise ever! I literally sat, mouth agape for 30 minutes by the end of this game, reeling from the ending!
This is a good story. I love it so much.
MUITO BOM MDSSSSSSSS, Historia 10/10, jogue os anteriores se possivel e a dlc vai te ajudara a entender a historia tbm kkkk

Игра с отличным сюжетом и экшеном, который не даст заскучать.

10/10

simplesmente uma obra prima, graficos lindos,jogabilida perfeita e as musicas do jogo nem se fala são muito boas. vale cada centavo investido nele!!

Atemberaubend schön und trotzdem erschreckend fesselnd. Bioshock Infinite vereint eine spannende Story mit großartigem, anspruchsvollem Gameplay und einer immernoch atemberaubenden Grafik, dank der besten Shader, die mir jeh in einem Spiel untergekommen sind.

Is simply amazing! how this story revolves over one of the most weird and yet revolutionary ideas of modern science. How it fits within the lore of the game and how creative this game is... I simply love it!
One of the best video game ever. The art, the story, the music, the graphics, the characters: this game has it all!
Amazing game
muito bom

[h1] “Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt”[/h1]

Bioshock Infinite is the final game in its trilogy, but can frankly stand out as its own due to its original story. The story, the art style and the characters manage to charm the player from the first glance and keep them immersed in its universe.


You follow the steps of Booker Dewitt, an american citizen with a mysterious that has been given a task to retrieve a girl that resides in a city in the clouds AKA Columbia. It may have seem as your everyday rescue mission, but the second he arrives to said city things take a little twist and the story will only become more and more complex as you make progress. 


One of the things I loved the most is your partner Elizabeth which, unlike many other companions, you don’t feel the burden to protect her all the time or just forget about her in the middle of a battle but will actually step out and help you with health, ammo and salts without having (while this can save you on many tricky situations you can’t by any means abuse that and have her carrying you over), later on she’ll learn to control an ability that allows to pull out certain elements to aid you further in combat. Whenever you’re out of combat and just exploring the corners of Columbia, let it be a side quest, looking for special gear or infusions to upgrade, you’ll notice that she’ll let you know about certain goodies that the player might miss out (lockpicks, a certain clue or money) proving that she’s far superior than most AI companions and personally I think that the developers just made a great job with her; you feel sympathy for her to the point that you form that special bond that not many characters can evoke.


The soundtrack is one of the best I’ve seen in a long time, it combines some past era music with original scores that just blend beautifully in the atmosphere. 


One thing that I have seen many people doing is to compare this game to its previous installments, and I consider that if you want to get the best experience of it is to try to avoid that. While they may be in the same universe they are definitely not story related and the gameplay does changes a bit (nothing groundbreaking in my opinion though). 


Something that I would like to point out is that this is one of the best optimized games I’ve ever seen, I’ve had the opportunity of playing it in a laptop with the lowest graphics cards, if you can call it that (obviously the settings were in no way maxed butl medium to high) and it ran smoothly for most of the game.
Jogo muito bom ! com uma história muita envolvente ! vale a pena !
Still one of the very best titles in the last 5-10 years
Buy this. First buy Bioshock. Then bioshock 2. Then this. Or whichever order you want. But buy this.

Bioshock Infinite gehört zu den besten Spielen, die ich jemals gespielt hab.
Es sieht aus wie ein Gemälde, das zum Leben erweckt wurde.
Die Story ist überdurchschnittlich und sehr gut erzählt, aber schwer zu verstehen.
Am Gameplay gibts eigentlich wenig zu meckern, es gibt viele Gegner, viele Fähigkeiten vielleicht zu wenig Schießeisen.
Alles in einem geiles Spiel, mit einer wahnsinnig guten Atmosphäre und Grafik.

Bioshock Infinite has to be my favourite game of all times. A perfect mix of social criticism and a fun FPS, that just makes this game stand out in the FPS franchise, in its series and as a title alone.

A pesar de cambiar su entorno, no le afecta en nada a esta tecera entrega ya que es unas para mi 
de las mejores franquicias que podria existir en la industria de los juegos.
Un estilo grafico explendido y una historia que te envuelve cada vez mas y mas hasta que finalmente te sumerge al mundo de bioshock.
Es genial como construyen una historia basandose en una utopía. 
En el apartado de jugabilidad, no se queda atras con su sistema de mejoras en habilidades y armas.
No muy dfiferente a sus anteriores entregas.
Resumiendo mi nota para esta entrega seria de un 9,3 de 10.
Un juego que debes jugar, revolucionario.

Tout le monde n'a pas adoré ce jeu... Et pourtant...
Pour moi, le scénario est absolument génial et bien construit. Le twist est sublime et ce changement d'ambiance par rapport à Bioschock 1 et 2 montre à quel point 2K a du talent pour ce genre de jeux.
Et très honnêtement, même si le scénario ne vous atteint pas, cela reste un FPS plus qu'honorable, surtout vu ce qui sort en triple A ces derniers temps...
Donc, n'hésitez pas à le découvrir, si vous ne l'avez pas encore fait!
